treeQuadrature.container_integrators package¶

Submodules¶

treeQuadrature.container_integrators.base_class module¶

class treeQuadrature.container_integrators.base_class.ContainerIntegral[source]¶

Bases: ABC

Abstract Base class for integrating a function on a container

abstract containerIntegral(container: Container, f: Callable[[...], ndarray], **kwargs: Any) → dict[source]¶
Parameters:

  • container (Container) – the container on which the integral of f should be evaluated

  • f (function) – takes X : np.ndarray and return np.ndarray, see pdf method of Distribution class in distributions.py

  • kwargs (Any) – other arguments allowed, must set default values

Returns:

  • integral (float) value of the integral of f on the container

  • and other necessary results

Return type:

dict

treeQuadrature.container_integrators.gp_integral module¶

class treeQuadrature.container_integrators.gp_integral.AdaptiveRbfIntegral(n_samples: int = 15, n_splits: int = 4, max_redraw: int = 4, threshold: float = 0.7, threshold_direction: str = 'up', fit_residuals: bool = True, scoring: ~typing.Callable | None = None, GPFit: ~typing.Type[~treeQuadrature.gaussian_process.fit_gp.GPFit] = <class 'treeQuadrature.gaussian_process.fit_gp.SklearnGPFit'>, gp_params: dict = {}, sampler: ~treeQuadrature.samplers.base_class.Sampler = <treeQuadrature.samplers.uniform_sampler.UniformSampler object>, keep_samples: bool = False, check_GP: bool = False)[source]¶

Bases: ContainerIntegral

Use Gaussian Process with RBF kernel, with length scale and search range determined adaptively to the container

n_samples¶

number of samples to draw

Type:

int

n_splits¶

number of K-fold cross-validation splits if n_splits = 0, K-Fold CV will not be performed.

Type:

int

max_redraw¶

maximum number of times to increase the number of samples in GP fitting. Should NOT be too large.

Type:

int

scoring¶

A scoring function to evaluate the GP predictions. It must accept three arguments: the true values, the predicted values, posterior std. If not provided, default is predictive log likelihood

Type:

Callable

thershold¶

minimum score that must be achieved by Gaussian Process.

Type:

float

threshold_direction¶

one of ‘up’ and ‘down’. for iterative GP fitting if ‘up’, accept the model if score >= performance_threshold; if ‘down’, accept the model if score >= performance_threshold

Type:

str

GPFit¶

any subclass of GPFit for fitting gaussian process

Type:

Type[GPFit]

gp_params¶

The parameters for initialising GPFit object

Type:

dict

fit_residuals¶

if True, GP is fitted to residuals instead of samples

Type:

bool

sampler¶

used for drawing samples in the container

Type:

Sampler

keep_samples¶

whether keep the original samples used to build tree or not when fitting GP

Type:

bool

check_GP¶

if True, generate the GP diagnostic plots

Type:

bool

containerIntegral(container: Container, f: Callable[[...], ndarray], return_std: bool = False) → Dict[source]¶
Parameters:

  • container (Container) – the container on which the integral of f should be evaluated

  • f (function) – takes X : np.ndarray and return np.ndarray

  • return_std (bool) – if True, returns the posterior std of integral estimate

Returns:

  • integral (float) value of the integral of f on the container

  • std (float) standard deviation of integral, if .return_std = True

  • hyper_params (dict) hyper-parameters of the fitted kernel

  • performance (float) GP goodness of fit score

Return type:

dict

class treeQuadrature.container_integrators.gp_integral.IterativeGpIntegral(n_samples: int, n_splits: int, fit_residuals: bool, scoring: Callable, score_direction: str, GPFit: Type[GPFit], gp_params: dict, sampler: Sampler)[source]¶

Bases: ContainerIntegral

abstract containerIntegral(container: Container, f: Callable, return_std: bool, previous_samples: Tuple[ndarray, ndarray])[source]¶

Takes previous samples and draw new samples to perform fitting again.

Parameters:

  • container (Container) – the container on which the integral of f should be evaluated

  • f (function) – takes X : np.ndarray and return np.ndarray,

  • return_std (bool) – if True, returns the posterior std of integral estimate

  • previous_samples (tuple, optional) – if provided, it contains (xs, ys) from the previous iteration

Returns:

  • dict –

    • integral (float) value of the integral of f on the container

    • std (float) standard deviation of integral, if .return_std = True

    • hyper_params (dict) hyper-parameters of the fitted kernel

    • performance (float) GP goodness of fit score

  • tuple(np.ndarray, np.ndarray) – samples xs, ys used by this iteration

class treeQuadrature.container_integrators.gp_integral.IterativeRbfIntegral(n_samples: int = 20, n_splits: int = 4, fit_residuals: bool = True, scoring: ~typing.Callable | None = <function r2>, score_direction='up', GPFit: ~typing.Type[~treeQuadrature.gaussian_process.fit_gp.GPFit] = <class 'treeQuadrature.gaussian_process.fit_gp.SklearnGPFit'>, gp_params: dict = {}, sampler: ~treeQuadrature.samplers.base_class.Sampler = <treeQuadrature.samplers.uniform_sampler.UniformSampler object>)[source]¶

Bases: IterativeGpIntegral

A modified version of AdaptiveRbfIntegral that allows iterative sample drawing and fitting of the Gaussian Process model. This is specifically used for integrators where containers should be coordinating together. e.g. DistributedGpTreeIntegrator

n_samples¶

number of samples to draw in each container

Type:

int

n_splits¶

number of K-fold cross-validation splits if n_splits = 0, K-Fold CV will not be performed.

Type:

int

scoring¶

A scoring function to evaluate the GP predictions. It must accept three arguments: the true values, the predicted values, posterior std. If not provided, default is predictive log likelihood

Type:

Callable

score_direction¶

one of ‘up’ and ‘down’ if up, higher score is better if down, lower score is better

Type:

str

GPFit¶

any subclass of GPFit for fitting gaussian process

Type:

Type[GPFit]

gp_params¶

The parameters for initialising GPFit object

Type:

dict

fit_residuals¶

if True, GP is fitted to residuals instead of samples

Type:

bool

sampler¶

used for drawing samples in the container

Type:

Sampler

containerIntegral(container: Container, f: Callable[[...], ndarray], return_std: bool = False, previous_samples: Tuple[ndarray, ndarray] | None = None)[source]¶

Takes previous samples and draw new samples to perform fitting again.

Parameters:

  • container (Container) – the container on which the integral of f should be evaluated

  • f (function) – takes X : np.ndarray and return np.ndarray,

  • return_std (bool) – if True, returns the posterior std of integral estimate

  • previous_samples (tuple, optional) – if provided, it contains (xs, ys) from the previous iteration

Returns:

  • dict –

    • integral (float) value of the integral of f on the container

    • std (float) standard deviation of integral, if .return_std = True

    • hyper_params (dict) hyper-parameters of the fitted kernel

    • performance (float) GP goodness of fit score

  • tuple(np.ndarray, np.ndarray) – samples xs, ys used by this iteration

class treeQuadrature.container_integrators.gp_integral.KernelIntegral(GPFit: ~typing.Type[~treeQuadrature.gaussian_process.fit_gp.GPFit] = <class 'treeQuadrature.gaussian_process.fit_gp.SklearnGPFit'>, gp_params: dict = {}, kernel: ~typing.Any | None = None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: ContainerIntegral

use Gaussian process with RBF kernel by default to estimate the integral value on a container assumes uniform prior used

length¶

the initial value of the length scale of RBF kernel default 1.0

Type:

int or float

range¶

GPRegressor will search hyper-parameter among (length * 1/range, length * range) Default 1e3

Type:

int or float

thershold¶

minimum score that must be achieved by Gaussian Process.

Type:

float

n_samples¶

number of samples to be drawn in each round of IterativeGPFitting

Type:

int

n_splits¶

number of K-fold cross-validation splits if n_splits = 0, K-Fold CV will not be performed.

Type:

int

threshold_direction¶

one of ‘up’ and ‘down’. if ‘up’, accept the model if score >= performance_threshold; if ‘down’, accept the model if score >= performance_threshold

Type:

str

max_redraw¶

maximum number of times to increase the number of samples in GP fitting. Should NOT be too large.

Type:

int

check_GP¶

if true, print diagnostics of GP prediction variance, mean squared error and r^2 score

Type:

bool

fit_residuals¶

if True, GP is fitted to residuals instead of samples

Type:

bool

gp¶

default is SklearnGPFit

Type:

GPFit

iGP¶

the iterative fitter used by this instance

Type:

IterativeGPFit

containerIntegral(container: Container, f: Callable, return_std: bool = False, **kwargs: Any)[source]¶

Gaussian Process is fitted iteratively

Parameters:

  • container (Container) – the container on which the integral of f should be evaluated

  • f (function) – takes X : np.ndarray and return np.ndarray, see pdf method of Distribution class in distributions.py

  • return_std (bool) – if True, returns the posterior std of integral estimate

  • kwargs (Any) – other arguments allowed (see class attributes)

Returns:

  • integral (float) the integral estimate

  • std (float) standard deviation of integral, if return_std = True

  • hyper_params (dict) hyper-parameters of the fitted kernel

  • performance (float) GP goodness of fit score

Return type:

dict

class treeQuadrature.container_integrators.gp_integral.PolyIntegral(degrees: ~typing.List[int], coeffs=None, n_samples: int = 20, n_splits: int = 4, max_redraw: int = 4, threshold: float = 10, fit_residuals: bool = True, GPFit: ~typing.Type[~treeQuadrature.gaussian_process.fit_gp.GPFit] = <class 'treeQuadrature.gaussian_process.fit_gp.SklearnGPFit'>, gp_params: dict = {}, sampler: ~treeQuadrature.samplers.base_class.Sampler = <treeQuadrature.samplers.uniform_sampler.UniformSampler object>)[source]¶

Bases: ContainerIntegral

Use Gaussian Process with a Polynomial kernel, with degree and coefficient determined by grid search.

degrees¶

degrees of polynomials to search through

Type:

List[int]

coeffs¶

range of coefficients to search from for polynomial kernel

Type:

ArrayLike

n_samples¶

number of samples drawn in each iteration

Type:

int

n_splits¶

Number of K-fold cross-validation splits. If n_splits = 0, K-Fold CV will not be performed.

Type:

int

max_redraw¶

Maximum number of times to increase the number of samples in GP fitting. Should NOT be too large.

Type:

int

threshold¶

Minimum score that must be achieved by Gaussian Process.

Type:

float

GPFit¶

any subclass of GPFit for fitting gaussian process

Type:

Type[GPFit]

gp_params¶

The parameters for initialising GPFit object

Type:

dict

iGP¶

The iterative fitter used by this instance. Though max_redraw = 0 in this case, as number of samples scale with volume of container instead.

Type:

IterativeGPFit

fit_residuals¶

If True, GP is fitted to residuals instead of samples.

Type:

bool

return_std¶

If True, returns the posterior std of integral estimate.

Type:

bool

containerIntegral(container: Container, f: Callable[[...], ndarray], return_std: bool = False) → Dict[source]¶
Parameters:

  • container (Container) – The container on which the integral of f should be evaluated.

  • f (function) – Takes X : np.ndarray and returns np.ndarray.

  • return_std (bool) – If True, returns the posterior std of integral estimate.

Returns:

  • integral (float) value of the integral of f on the container.

  • std (float) standard deviation of integral, if return_std = True.

  • hyper_params (dict) hyper-parameters of the fitted kernel.

  • performance (float) GP goodness of fit score.

Return type:

dict

treeQuadrature.container_integrators.monte_carlo_integral module¶

class treeQuadrature.container_integrators.monte_carlo_integral.RandomIntegral(n_samples: int = 10, eval: ~typing.Callable = <function mean>, error_estimate: ~typing.Callable | None = None, sampler: ~treeQuadrature.samplers.base_class.Sampler = <treeQuadrature.samplers.uniform_sampler.UniformSampler object>)[source]¶

Bases: ContainerIntegral

Monte Carlo integrator: redraw samples, and estimate integrand by the a constant value

Parameters:

  • n_samples (int) – number of samples to be redrawn for evaluating the integral. Default : 10

  • eval (function) – Should take a np.ndarray (samples of integrand) and return a float (aggregated value). Default is mean

  • error_estimate (function) – must be provided when eval is not mean nor median. Used to obtain an estimate of the uncertainty

  • sampler (Sampler) – The sampler used to draw samples in the container Default is UniformSampler

containerIntegral(container: Container, f: Callable, return_std: bool = False)[source]¶
Parameters:

  • container (Container) – the container on which the integral of f should be evaluated

  • f (function) – takes X : np.ndarray and return np.ndarray, see pdf method of Distribution class in distributions.py

  • kwargs (Any) – other arguments allowed, must set default values

Returns:

  • integral (float) value of the integral of f on the container

  • and other necessary results

Return type:

dict
